item.title: Pwnable.tw - Seethefile
item.description: seethefile [250 pts] Can you see anything? Get a shell for me. seethefile libc.so.6 This challenge relies on a technique known as FILE structure exploitation. I will not be covering the topic within this post, so I would recommend a read. Arch: i386-32-little RELRO: Partial RELRO Stack: No canary found NX: NX enabled PIE: No PIE (0x8048000) We can see that there are no memory corruption mitigations enabled that seem out of the ordinary.

item.title: FILE Structure Exploitation
item.description: Introduction The technique known as FILE structure exploitation is a technique which aims to abuse the FILE struct within libc. This structure, as well as it’s associated set of functions, is used as a buffered input and output stream. This allows for more optimized i/o as it performs less read and writes, which allows for less context switching into the kernel. However, if used incorrectly, the FILE structure can be abused to gain various exploit primitives.
